17831250.review:
Port of Call ist ein schönes, kurzes Spiel bei dem es weniger um Gameplay, sondern eher um die Story geht. Und da ich ein großer Fan von Games dieses Genres bin, konnte ich mir dieses, das obendrein auch noch kostenlos ist, nicht entgehen lassen ;)

Zur Steuerung:
Die Steuerung ist - für solch ein minimalistisches Spiel wie Port of Call - vollkommen ausreichend und zufridenstellend. Die teilweise Controllerunterstützung die hier bei Steam angegeben ist funktioniert mit einem 360-Controller einwandfrei, abgesehen davon, dass sich das Pausenmenü nicht mit Start aufrufen lässt, sondern man tatsächlich auf den esc-Knopf der Tastatur zurückgreifen muss. Mich persönlich hat dies allerdings nicht gestört, vor allem da das Spiel wirklich nur sehr kurz ist und man es so nicht unbedingt unterbrechen muss ^^

Zur Grafik:
Naja, was soll man hier schon groß sagen? Bei Port of Call handelt es sich ganz offensichtlich um ein Indiegame und das sieht man der Grafik auch leider sehr an. Nicht besonders überragend, aber Schlimmeres habe ich allemal schon gesehen, auch bei Spielen die etwas gekostet haben ^^

Zur Story:
Leider hatte die Story für mein Empfinden selbst für die kurze Spieldauer etwas zu wenig Tiefgang, sodass mich selbst das Ende bzw die "Auflösung" der Situation nicht unbedingt berühren konnte. Die Dialoge sind alle sehr knapp gehalten, sodass man auch wirklich nur das nötigste von den Charakteren erfährt - auch die verschiedenen Dialogoptionen führen letztendlich doch zu den selben bzw. ähnlichen Antworten. 
Vielleicht ist das ja wirklich nur mein Eindruck, weil ich nicht bei jedem toten Kind in Videospielen gleich in Tränen ausbreche (Himmel, das sind auch nur Menschen, genau wie Erwachsene xD)  allerdings finde ich dies doch sehr schade, da die Story doch gerade der Grund dafür war, dass ich mir das Spiel gedownloaded habe ;)

Fazit:
Auch wenn mein Review fast nur die negativen Seiten des Spiels aufgreift, so möchte ich doch eine Empfehlung für Port of Call aussprechen. Gerade in Zeiten, in denen so viele Indiegames praktisch einfach nur versuchen, Five Nights at Freddy's oder Slender nachzuahmen, schlägt Port of Call eine ganz andere Richtung ein indem es sich auf die Story konzentriert. So erschafft das Spiel dennoch eine düstere bis fast schon gruselige Atmosphäre...und das ganz ohne nervige Jumpscares ;)
Wer auf der Suche nach einem Spiel ist, mit dem er sich die Zeit vertreiben und einfach mal abschalten und Dialoge lesen kann - hier wird er bestens bedient. Und hey...das Spiel ist kostenlos! ;D


AUßERDEM möchte ich an dieser Stelle eine Triggerwarnung aussprechen, da in Port of Call (offensichtlich) Themen wie der Tod von geliebten Menschen und Selbstmord angesprochen werden.

17830772.review: No matter what you say or do it ends in a choice of two different ways. The talking parts only really tell a short story. I enjoyed playing it, but looking back on it there really wasn't much in it. Get it anyway because it's free so...why not?

17827870.review:
[b]'Port of Call'[/b] is an experimental and free game, where you will be confronted with the topics life and death.

[b]Desc:[/b]
You don't know who you are, where you are and what you are doing. You know nothing, but after some dialogues will figure out what's going on.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ artwork and music fits to the type of the game
+ good implementation for a game about life and death
+ story is much better than many other commercial games
+ characters are not dull, each character has it's own temper, story and lifestyle
+ you will get a special/chilled feeling by getting the story revealed step by step

[b]Cons:[/b]
- too tidy (deck of the ship and other places could contain more objects like ropes, carpets, nets etc.)
- short game duration
- devs haven't used all options of the story they are telling (what about flashbacks, more characters, more mythology?)
- the answers you choose in the dialogues have no effect to the ending of the game (sadly; you choose your end of your own)
- walk speed is a bit too slow (the slowness is not a problem, but it's too slow IMHO)
- some textures are breaking with the artwork (like the pillars/smokestacks on the deck)

[b]Recommended[/b], because it's a nice story with ambitions to a greater story telling, it's for free and it has a unique comic driven artwork.

[b]5/10[/b]

P.S.: [spoiler]Hopefully none of the devs have had such experiences/failures like the protagonist of 'Port of Call' has.[/spoiler]

17824106.review:
Port of Call is an intriguing, yet short, game, that delivers on the intrigue.

=======

CONS:

- Partial voice-acting: This kind of lends a certain type of feel to the game, having the minimal voices in-game, but also is a sort of pet peeve of mine. If you're going to have well-done voices (for what little there is), why not just go full-steam-ahead? ... xD I'm putting this one under both PROs and CONs as it is suitable here, but not desired by me.

- Slow movement: I understand that the character needs to move slowly so as to keep the pace of the game from being over in less time than the DEV would like, but... it's too slow. I want to be able to run around looking for paintings, and crayons; not be stepping in gum with every footfall. 


PROs: 

+ Partial voice-acting: Although a pet-peeve of mine, suits the style of the game very well. Included in both CONs and PROs, as I generally dislike partial voice-acting in games, and prefer either all-in or none, but it's well suited, so no points for or against, in my books.

+ Ambiance: Very good; sounds and music set the tone of the environment very well, and give it that mysterious, yet familiar quality.

+ Style: I like the art style, as well as the choice of paintings, and character designs. Very well done :)

=======
Do I recommend?
Yes, very much so :)

It's a short little game, with no real replay value (aside from getting the achivements), but it's a neat little narrative with a good concept, that deserves a play-through. 

Now... where to find a mask like the ones the NPCs wore...
*Wanders off into the internet*

Not a bad way to spend 30 or 40 minutes.  Port of Call has some nice minimal artwork, a slightly spooky feel to it and a tiny bit sad story that unfolds as you play. I did notice one tiny glitch . . . there were a few times that the conversations jumped ahead an extra step, too fast for me to read the piece that got skipped.  Again, whaddya want for free.

17816374.review:
Короткая, грустная и красивая игра.

1) Сюжет: главный герой оказывается на пристани посреди бескрайнего океана, и здесь его ждет паром с мрачным капитаном (явно коллегой Харона). Герой должен собрать билеты у пассажиров, узнать их истории, и попутно принять (или не принять, зависит от игрока) свою собственную историю со всеми её ошибками. А на финальной остановке корабля, героя ждет выбор. Чтобы мы ни выбрали, гламурного хэппи-энда не будет. Игра здесь довольно жизненна. Вообщем сюжет это то ради чего эту игру стоит пройти. Повествование здесь в меру философское, но не перегруженное слишком сложными для восприятия вещами, чем грешат некоторые арт-игры.

2) Музыка: она здесь тиха, и хорошо создает атмосферу тихой безнадеги.

3) Графика: в меру сюррелистично, в меру простенько но со вкусом.

4) Язык: игра на английском, русского здесь нет, а ближе к развязке будет персонаж говорящий стихами. Так что если Вы не знаете английский, игра будет менее понятна, так-как на повествовании завязан весь процесс.

5) Продолжительность: игру при желании можно осилить за 15-20 минут (второе прохождение у меня столько и заняло), но если будете собирать все ачивки, осматривать корабль, и вчитываться в диалоги - пройдете её минут за 40-60 максимум.

Как итог: очень красивая игра со смыслом. Рекомендую всем любителям квестов и повествовательных игр.
8 маяков из 10

17796887.review:
This neat little game, which was announced at the 2014 E3 College Game Competition, is definitely worth checking out.

"Port of Call" begins with the protagonist, who is unnamed and suffers from amnesia, waking up on a dock and boarding a ship that seemed to materialize out of nothing. It is helmed by a mysterious hooded man who towers over you, and the story unfolds as you meet with the other passengers aboard the ship.

The game, in the same style as "Gone Home" or "Dear Esther", is a walking sim, with atmosphere and narrative being the focus. While the game itself doesn't bring anything groundbreaking to the genre, it is a neat little story that you can knock out as you're having your morning cup of coffee.

Plus it's free, and who doesn't like free things?

Underdog Games are still finding their feet (this being their first release), but this is a game worth checking out, and if you like walking sims, you won't be disappointed.

17773330.review:
A short but very enjoyable game. It has a cut down, almost simplistic, art style that works really well with the subject matter and gives the game a distinctive identity.  The story in good enough to keep you engaged. Anyone familiar with greek mythology will pick up on what's going on almost immediately. But it's a fun story either way. While not getting too serious the themes and message that the game delivers(depending on how much you read into or think about it in the end) are well worth considering also.

You'll spend most of your time talking to the other passangers on a boat, trying to piece together the story of who you are and how you got to be on this mysterious river boat. Collecting tickets and trying your hand at barkeeping along the way.

There are a few easy achievements in it for achievement hunter. The game should last 30 to 60 mins, and it's free. So a very good way to waste a little time. Just don't expect fireworks or explosions.

I have to admit that the game feels almost like a proof of concept. If that is the case then it is a very successful one and I'd be interested to see what else the developer has to offer.

17772183.review:
Port of Call est un jeu d'exploration à la première personne dans lequel l'accent est placé sur la narration.

Vous vous trouvez sur un ponton, seul, sans souvenirs. Un vieil homme apparait alors derrière vous et vous ordonne de vous mettre au travail sur son bateau. Un bateau qui semble être apparu de nulle part lui aussi. Vous êtes donc chargés de récupérer les tickets de quelques passagers énigmatiques pour lesquels vous avez un visage familier...
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=508130126 Un mystère plane sur les lieux d'autant plus que vous croiserez des ombres, des livres volants ou encore des personnages masqués. Le scénario remplit bien son rôle, d'abord décontenancés et incrédules, on va, au fur et à mesure de nos discussions avec les passagers, comprendre l'histoire. Mêlant amour, peine, culpabilité, regret et mort, l'intrigue est bien amenée même si elle n'est pas totalement originale et qu'on devine un peu les enjeux avant la fin elle n'en reste pas moins plaisante. 

Les graphismes ne sont pas le point fort de jeu, grossiers et artistiquement banals, on a déjà vu mieux même de la part de jeux gratuits. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=508130206 Toutefois l'atmosphère étrange des lieux parvient à nous atteindre malgré tout, bien qu'un travail plus conséquent sur l'ambiance sonore, quasiment absente aurait là aussi permis une meilleure immersion. 

Néanmoins notre attention est gardée tout au long des 20-30 minutes de jeu grâce à la narration de qualité et au mystère qui plane sur les lieux et sur notre propre personnage. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=508130373 Au final, Port of Call est un bon jeu gratuit sans prétention qui n'est pas exempt de défauts mais qui parvient aisément à nous tenir en haleine grâce à son scénario intriguant. 

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

So at the time of my review,I had just beaten the game.Which will take 20-40 minutes at an estimate.And in the short time I was engaged in this game,I was introduced into literally the best story in video game history.Yes better than The Last Of Us,The Walking Dead and Bioshock Infinite.When you start this game,youre on a mysterious dock,in the very middle of the ocean.You meet an old man in a rain jacket,and follow him to a boat that came out of seemingly no where.At this point I was convinced this game was going to be a funny,goofy,feel good game.I was so wrong.

Gameplay:The gameplay pretty much WASD,of course clicking the mouse to interact with things and talk with people.The game has the old man to ask you to go around and retrieve tickets from passengers.And the characters you meet(about 5 including the old man)are all incredibly interesting.And personally are some of my favorite characters of all time now.The game has a dialgoue system which is pretty much all you do,talk.And of course walk and find the passengers.

Story:WONT CRY....WONT CRY.....I wont say much of anything about the story,because how short this game is and how legendary this games story is.I get chills simply from the thought of it.Plus,the sound track,while its restricted to when your talking to someone,its still great.Now if youre angry because I wont tell you the story,its free,and its too good to say a word for.Just play it.You WILL be glad you did.

When I get down to my final verdict,I refuse to give it anything but a 10/10.And thats exactly what im giving it.I cant describe how amazing this game is.Play this game.Right now.At once,because well, theres a reason this has 100% positive reviews.Peace Out.

17755300.review:
WARNING: This review may have spoilers. Please read at your own risk.

This is probably one of the strangest narrative games I've ever played, welp here goes.

STORY: You play as a stranger who has no memory of who he/she is. H/she is summoned to a ship by a ferryman and its your job to collect four peoples tickets. 

The story is strange and kinda all over the place but you'll probably understand it more than I could.

 I really think these people/ferryman were inspired by the greek legend Charon and him and his ferry bringing the dead towards the afterlife/underworld.7/10

GRAPHICS: The graphics are okay and adaquete at best. Though it is very creepy imho.6.5/10

GAMEPLAY: Its a total immersion game. You walk around, talk to people, look at stuff and pick them up. Thats about it. 7/10

VERDICT: This is very VERY short, but it had an okay story, adaquete graphics but I do have to say you should give this game a chance since its free.7/10
